bug.author: cornelg7
bug.summary: Always rerun doesn't work with VSCode
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The "Always re-run" button doesn't seem to work when editing files with VSCode. It only appears the first time after I refresh localhost (and edit my file), which is normal. But, for any further source code edits I need to manually re-run the file (press R inside localhost). This works as intended while editing the file with other file editors (tested on Notepad++, Notepad). <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Create new basic main.py file:
<denchmark-code>import streamlit as st st.title('My first app') </denchmark-code>
Start server: streamlit run main.py --server.port=80 Open main.py in VSCode and edit it Click on Always re-run (the file re-runs and displays the edit) Edit main.py in VSCode again (this time the file doesn't re-runs)
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
The result in localhost should have updated based on the edited source code. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The localhost generated file doesn't automatically re-run after editing the main.py file in VSCode. <denchmark-link:https://camo.githubusercontent.com/5c067a5d7f501ad2c38588ecf2422ffe8e5615ef8cdee6f062444d2311098fa8/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f336356466471592e676966></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
This is my first time using streamlit. <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: 0.52.2 Python version: 3.7.4 Using Conda 4.8.1, with pip 19.2.3 OS version: Windows 10 Browser version: Google Chrome 79.0.3945.117
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
I followed this: <denchmark-link:https://docs.streamlit.io/getting_started.html#import-streamlit>https://docs.streamlit.io/getting_started.html#import-streamlit</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Thanks for the report, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornelg7>@cornelg7</denchmark-link> ! I can repro this on Windows 10/VSCode 1.4.1. Probably a watchdog issue? We'll triage it and take a look soon.

Hi guys, After a significant investigation in which I did see failure to re-run in VSCode on multiple platforms, I tried to modify the watchdog code that's triggered in streamlit/watcher/util.py to see if we were seeing a race condition -- the MD5s kept comparing as equal even when the file appeared to be modified. Long story short, I don't think we can mess with this code without causing other problems. There are a lot of different strategies by which editors touch files and OSes update the information on those files. It looks like [previous versions of?] VSCode may have a strategy wherein the file modified date changes a few significant moments before the contents of the file change. If we change how we monitor the files just for VSCode I think we may get problems elsewhere. The recommendation on this problem should be to upgrade VScode.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nthmost>@nthmost</denchmark-link> , which version of VSCode does this work for?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cornelg7>@cornelg7</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tconkling>@tconkling</denchmark-link> could you confirm that upgrading VSCode to 1.45 fixes the issue for you?
